summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and Larry Fallek regarding potential testimony in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The AUSA inquires about Fallek's availability to testify, while Fallek provides his travel plans and confirms his availability.

persons.name: Larry Fallek
persons.context: Attorney at Fallek & Fallek, PLLC who is being asked about his availability to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell for which testimony is being sought.

connections.description: Fallek is being asked to testify as a witness in the criminal trial against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prosecutor contacting potential witness to arrange testimony in the Maxwell trial.

events.title: United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial preparation
events.description: Ongoing trial preparation with prosecutors contacting potential witnesses for testimony.

events.title: Larry Fallek's planned trip to Atlanta
events.description: Fallek plans to visit his son in Atlanta during these dates, which could affect his availability to testify.

locations: 116 East 65th Street (referenced in case name Barr v. 116 East 65th Street LLC)
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were actively preparing witnesses for testimony in December 2021.
Larry Fallek, an attorney, was identified as a potential witness in the Maxwell trial.
The correspondence shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and potential witnesses regarding trial scheduling.
The email thread references both the criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell) and a civil case (Barr v. 116 East 65th Street LLC).
The communication emphasizes attorney-client privilege and confidentiality in the correspondence.
